Title: An Act Creating Barangay Ibung South in the Municipality of Villaverde, Province of Nueva Vizcaya, into a New Barangay to be Known as Barangay Ibung South
Data:
BATAS PAMBANSA Blg. 889
An Act Creating Barangay Ibung South in the Municipality of Villaverde, Province of Nueva Vizcaya, into a New Barangay to be Known as Barangay Ibung South
Section 1. Sitio Ibung South in the Municipality of Villaverde, Province of Nueva Vizcaya, is constituted into a new and distinct barangay to be known as Barangay Ibung South.1âwphi1
Section 2. The boundaries of the new barangay shall be: From point 1, at the boundary of the Municipality of Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya and the Municipality of Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya, a straight line following the EEA provincial road going northwest, traversing Barangay Ibung to Pimentel Street up to point 2, at the boundary of Barangay Nagbitin and Ibung, thence, westward traversing the property of Maria Logan and Rufo Paras, following the boundary of Nagbitin and Ibung, at point 3, upstream to point 4, thence, southwest to point 5, thence, to west at point 6, at the Balacquit Creek, thence, following downstream to point 7, at the bridge, thence, south to point 8, the Green Lady Monument, the boundary of Barangay Poblacion, thence, east, a straight line up to point 9, the boundary of the Municipality of Bagabag, Nueva Vizcaya and the Municipality of Villaverde, Nueva Vizcaya, thence, northeast, to point 1.
Section 3. After the approval of the creation of Barangay Ibung South by the majority of the votes cast in a plebiscite to be conducted in the area affected within one hundred twenty days from the approval of this Act, the President of the Philippines shall appoint the first officials of barangay Ibung South who shall hold office until their successors shall have been duly elected and shall have qualified.
Section 4. The Commission on Elections shall conduct and supervise the holding of the plebiscite and the expenses for such plebiscite shall be charged to the appropriations of the Commission on Elections for the said purpose.1âwphi1
Section 5. This Act shall take effect upon its approval.
Approved: December 3, 1985
